Class SimpleBoard

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.Logic.SimpleBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Board
public class SimpleBoard extends Object implements Board
Represents the game board logic, handling grid state, brick movement, and game mode specifics. Implements the Board interface.
Author:
Abdullah Usmani

  • Constructor Details

    • SimpleBoard

      public SimpleBoard(int width, int height)
      Constructs a SimpleBoard and initializes game components.
      Parameters:
      width - Number of rows (vertical size).
      height - Number of columns (horizontal size).

  • Method Details

    • getBombManager

      public BombManager getBombManager()
      Gets the BombManager instance.
      Returns:
      The BombManager.

    • injectGarbageRow

      public void injectGarbageRow()
      Injects a row of garbage blocks at the bottom for Dig mode. Shifts existing blocks up and creates a new row with a random hole.

    • moveBrickDown

      public boolean moveBrickDown()
      Attempts to move the current brick one unit down. Checks for collisions with the bottom of the board or other blocks.
      Specified by:
      moveBrickDown in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the move was successful, false if the brick is blocked.

    • moveBrickLeft

      public boolean moveBrickLeft()
      Attempts to move the current brick one unit to the left. Checks for collisions with the left wall or other blocks.
      Specified by:
      moveBrickLeft in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the move was successful, false otherwise.

    • moveBrickRight

      public boolean moveBrickRight()
      Attempts to move the current brick one unit to the right. Checks for collisions with the right wall or other blocks.
      Specified by:
      moveBrickRight in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the move was successful, false otherwise.

    • rotateLeftBrick

      public boolean rotateLeftBrick()
      Attempts to rotate the current brick to the next shape state. Checks if the rotated shape fits within the board and doesn't collide with existing blocks.
      Specified by:
      rotateLeftBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if rotation was successful, false otherwise.

    • createNewBrick

      public boolean createNewBrick()
      Spawns a new brick for the game. Handles specific logic for Bomb mode activation and standard brick generation. Checks for immediate collisions to detect Game Over state.
      Specified by:
      createNewBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the new brick can be placed (game continues), false if collision occurs immediately (game over).

    • holdBrick

      public boolean holdBrick()
      Holds the current brick and swaps it with the previously held brick if available. Prevents holding more than once per turn.
      Specified by:
      holdBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the hold action was successful, false otherwise.

    • getBoardMatrix

      public int[][] getBoardMatrix()
      Retrieves the current state of the board's grid.
      Specified by:
      getBoardMatrix in interface Board
      Returns:
      A 2D array representing the board where non-zero values are occupied cells.

    • getViewData

      public ViewData getViewData()
      Generates a snapshot of the current view data for rendering. Includes current brick, next bricks, held brick, and ghost position.
      Specified by:
      getViewData in interface Board
      Returns:
      A ViewData object containing renderable game state.

    • mergeBrickToBackground

      public void mergeBrickToBackground()
      Locks the current brick into the board matrix. Updates the board state and checks if the merged brick was a bomb.
      Specified by:
      mergeBrickToBackground in interface Board

    • clearRows

      public ClearRow clearRows()
      Scans the board for completed rows to clear. Handles special clearing logic for Bomb bricks (clearing specific lines) and standard row clearing.
      Specified by:
      clearRows in interface Board
      Returns:
      A ClearRow object detailing the lines removed and score changes.

    • getScore

      public Score getScore()
      Retrieves the score object associated with this board.
      Specified by:
      getScore in interface Board
      Returns:
      The Score object.

    • newGame

      public void newGame()
      Resets the board state for a new game. Clears the matrix, resets score, bomb manager, and brick queues.
      Specified by:
      newGame in interface Board
